intro: Kundmannia sicula, commonly known as the Sicilian star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and delicate, white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Kundmannia sicula is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to tolerate saline conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
